overall_summary: Begum Khaleda Zia (born 15 August 1945) is the Chairperson of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and one of the most influential figures in Bangladesh’s modern political history. As the country’s first female Prime Minister, she served three terms between 1991 and 2006, overseeing key democratic transitions after years of military rule. Known for her resilience and mass appeal, she continues to symbolise BNP’s leadership despite health challenges and political restrictions. In recent years, she has been re-nominated to contest from Feni-1, Bogura-7, and Dinajpur-3.
